byline.contributor: Julie Turkewitz reported from Hartsel, Richard Fausset from Goose Creek, S.C., Alan Blinder from Black Mountain, N.C., and Benjamin Mueller from New York. Jack Healy, Dave Philipps and Kassondra Cloos contributed reporting from Colorado Springs; Michael S. Schmidt from Washington; and Ashley Southall, Liam Stack, Mike McIntire and Jack Begg from New York.
byline.original: By JULIE TURKEWITZ, RICHARD FAUSSET, ALAN BLINDER and BENJAMIN MUELLER

abstract: Investigation into Robert L Dear Jr, suspect who carried out shooting at Colorado Springs Planned Parenthood clinic, reveals itinerant loner with history of conflicts with law, neighbors and family; some acquaintances describe episodes of violence by Dear or feeling fearful of him.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Dear lived in a white trailer on a patch of land by the Rocky Mountains and was described as “a mountain culture person.”

headline.main: Robert Dear, Suspect in Colorado Killings, ‘Preferred to Be Left Alone’

snippet: Mr. Dear lived in a white trailer on a patch of land by the Rocky Mountains and was described as “a mountain culture person.”
